main event: Civilians reported seeing 3 lights in a half-moon shape over Myrtle Beach, Florence, S.C. from 9 - 12 January 1958.
interesting points: The lights were observed to flitter and move to the northeast,The sighting lasted between 5 to 30 minutes,The objects were initially thought to be Venus due to their location and brightness,A total of 8 civilians reported the observations at a time around 12:20 hours (EST),The report included discussions of possible explanations like weather balloons and aircraft but concluded that it might be Venus.
sighted object: three lights in a half-moon shape
